channel.title: Comments on: SSRS Properties – Background Image
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: rani
item.dc:creator: rani
item.description: This is really gave me a clue. I put a rectangle in list, and it works... Thank you so much
item.content:encoded:
This is really gave me a clue. I put a rectangle in list, and it works…
Thank you so much

item.title: By: Jes Borland
item.dc:creator: Jes Borland
item.description: I believe you'd have to drop a list in the box, then put a BackgroundImage on it, then specify the source for the image. I haven't done that, though, so it's a rough guess.
item.content:encoded: I believe you’d have to drop a list in the box, then put a BackgroundImage on it, then specify the source for the image. I haven’t done that, though, so it’s a rough guess.

item.title: By: rani
item.dc:creator: rani
item.description: is there a way to make background image for every row detail different? or every page maybe?
item.content:encoded:
is there a way to make background image for every row detail different?
or every page maybe?

item.title: By: Greg Low
item.dc:creator: Greg Low
item.description: If you just use the "embedded" option, it MIME encodes the image into the report RDL file. But it's usually better with these sorts of images, to source them from a dataset, given the way that organizations change their logos from time to time. Either way, it doesn't have to be deployed separately.
item.content:encoded: If you just use the “embedded” option, it MIME encodes the image into the report RDL file. But it’s usually better with these sorts of images, to source them from a dataset, given the way that organizations change their logos from time to time. Either way, it doesn’t have to be deployed separately.

item.content:encoded: David – not that I’m aware of. What problem are you trying to avoid (or fix)?

item.title: By: David Forck (thirster42)
item.dc:creator: David Forck (thirster42)
item.description: Is there a way to embed an image in a report without having to deploy the image seperately to reporting services? That's what I'm currently doing in a few locations. Would love it if I didn't have to.
item.content:encoded: Is there a way to embed an image in a report without having to deploy the image seperately to reporting services? That’s what I’m currently doing in a few locations. Would love it if I didn’t have to.
